intro: Lacinaria scariosa var. propinqua, commonly known as the scarious lacinaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
